intro: Kungia aliciae, commonly known as the Alice's kungia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
